text: Smith sits crouched inside, cleaning his nails.

A giant robot stands attached to its service bay. Still. A SERVICE DRAWER slides open and a shadowy infiltrator em face visible in the dim service light. Smith. Smith approaches the docked Robot, places a small keypad Robot's dormant CPU panel. Smith activates the device.
You'll forgive me if I forgo the kiss, my sleeping behemoth. Smith hits a switch on the panel and the Robot's system i light into life. Smith types several keys on the keypad.
But the time has come to awake.
Robot is on-line. Reviewing primary directives. One, preserve the Robinson Family. Two, Maintain ship systems. Three
Spare me the chatter. Smith taps the keypad. The Robot is silenced. Smith types
What noble charges my steely centurion. Sadly I fear you have far more dire deeds in store for you. Smith completes his re-programming. Hits a switch.
Robot is on-line. Reviewing primary directives. Two hours into mission destroy Robinson family. Destroy all systems. Smith smiles. Removes the re-programming module.
Now that's more like it. Farewell my tin-plated pal. Give my regards to oblivion. Smith climbs into a chute marked WASTE DISPOSAL.
Smith begins crawling down the chute. His tiny reprogramm BEEPS. Smith activates a tiny, built in com-link. From the mic, the familiar visage of the Businessman is p the crawlspace over Smith's face.
I told you never to call me here.

I see you have completed your mission on schedule Good work, Doctor. And goodbye. The Businessman smiles. SMITH-CLOSE. Puzzled. Suddenly the tiny module in his hand OVERLOADS, the flesh smoking as Smith is engulfed in an electrical charge. He body perfectly still. CHAPTER 8: Launch!
The giant dome shines in the early sun. INT-JUPITER ONE  John and Maureen face will and Penny who their freezing tubes. All  wear silver flight suits. Maur Penny's hair from in front of her face.

Will she wake up less annoying?

Alright you two, enough. Maureen kisses her children. John moves to will who reach at the same moment John tries to hug him. A beat. Then Jo shake as Will goes for the hug. A total miss. Will backs tube.
You get a C in paternal expression, Professor. But an A for effort. John kisses his wife, already in her tube.
You always get an A in that.
Don't let me shatter this unbridled display of affection, but we are running behind.
(entering his tube) Major, she's all yours.
I'll try to give you a smooth ride. Judy walks the row, checking their bio-monitors. Enters h

Roger, Doctor, you are go to initiate cryostasis. Don walks to Judy's tube.
One question, Doctor. in there room in these tubes for two?

Barely enough for you and your ego, Major. Drive carefully. (touches her com-link) initializing cryostasis tubes. The tubes rotate closed around the Robinsons. Welcome to the future. Banks of monitors manned by gum-ch haired technicians. A giant monitor shows the Jupiter on pad. The CONTROLLER (NOAH FREEMAN) pulls in to his consol

External fuel pressure to zero. Powering main drive systems.
The nuclear drive at the base of the saucer EXPLODES, the TREMBLING, straining towards the sky. INT.-MiSSION CONTROL

Houston, main drive systems to on line status. It's showtime.
Nuclear ENGINES ROAR. The ship begins to rise in a bolus

We're outta here.

The main screen shows a graphic of the Jupiter's trajecto ship arcs toward the outer edge of the atmosphere.
Jupiter One, you are clear Earth's atmosphere. A CHEER goes up in the control room.
The giant saucer shell EXPLODES, revealing the inner ship glittering high tech shape of the JUPITER TWO.
Don watches as the Earth recedes into a blue marble, flic orbital billboards growing distant. Smiles at the familia
Jupiter One booster disengaged. Proceeding towards Mercury.
Nuclear diodes at the ship's base spin into life, glowing fire, the ship now heading towards Mercury and beyond.
The Robot stands dormant in his service bay. HOLD on the service drawer in the b.g. PUSH IN.
Smith lies still, unconscious in the dark compartment.
Mercury hangs like a red moon in the front viewscreen.
Don presses a button and two giant blast shields close ov Jupiter Two's main viewscreen.

Houston, diverting all spacecraft controls to the main computer. (off mic) Eight years of flight training. He walks to the center of the bridge and activates the na holograph, images forming in mid-air over the pedestal. HOLOGRAPH- CLOSE. The Jupiter Two is visible, backed by t our solar system.
Navigational holographics on line. (off mic) Fifty combat missions. Don touches buttons and a highlight indicates the ship's past mercury, around the Sun in a slingshot and into spac
Course confirmed for slingshot exit of the solar system. (off mic) Just so I can take the family camper on an interstellar picnic. Don walks to the freezing tubes. He zips up his silver fl
Ten world series. My, nephews' high school and college graduations. A decade's worth of Sports Illustrated swimsuit editions. (a beat) Noah, ten years in a lifetime. West climbs into his tube.
Sleep well, old friend.
Don hits a switch and his tube closes. A beat then he is the blue glow, frozen in space. The tubes rise into the craft.
The ship flies on into the endless night.

The two are done fo puts her hand over Penny's eyes.

Robot. Return to your docking bay and power down.
Command accepted. The Robot turns and begins heading for the elevator. All amazement. Will grins, a familiar mischievous gleam in hi
If the family won't come to the science fair, bring the science fair to the family. An EXPLOSION rocks the ship.
Mom, look, it's Doctor Smith. Penny stands over Smith who lays crumpled in the corner. an emergency medi-kit from a wall clamp, tosses it to Pen
Pulse, respiration and bleeding-
Basic triage, lock down and stabilize. I know the drill. John is standing, helps Don to his feet.
NEXT picnic, no robots. Don moves fast to the helm. The main view screen is still covered by giant metal blast shields.
Communications links are down. Maureen is at the life sciences console.
Life support is at ten percent. Trying to bring secondary systems on line. It's not working. VIDEO MONITOR-POV. Penny is bandaging Smith's head, her b masking her fathoml4ss terror.
Explosions rock the ship. Danger is everywhere, 'Yet the Space Captive is fearless as she... A console FLARES. Penny fights back tears, terrified.
I want to go home now. Don is at the navigational system.
Rerouting power from the secondary couplings. Try it again.
Finding a power tap.... Suddenly the lights go on, the air compressors begin to H
Life support is back on line.
I can't get the blast shields open. We're flying blind. Penny in working ever Smith, bandaging his head. She runs under his nose. Smith begins to stir, COUGHING.
I've got life signs. (wincing) Boy, somebody could use a breath mint. West turns, spots Smith for the first time.
(to John) Try the emergency back-ups. Don moves to the fallen figure, lifts him up against the
Smith, what the hell-

I was making a last minute check ... someone hit me from behind. Don almost buys it. Then he notices Smith's hand, grabs i BURN-CLOSE. The reprogramming module's distinctive, forei seared into his flesh.
Sino-Jordanian technology. You're a Goddamned spy. (realizing) You did this. Don slams him against the bulkhead, begins dragging him t airlock. The pilot hits a switch. The inner hatch opens.
Stop. What are you doing?
Dropping some extra weight.
Help, somebody. Please.
Maureen stands at Judy's freezing tube. The young doctor' is sparking on and off.
The thawing engine in broken. can't get her out. She's dying. Smith uses the distraction to palm-slam Don in the chin, backwards. Don staggers, goes again for Smith.
Touch me and the girl dies. Don freezes in his tracks.
Your mission physician is indisposed. I can save her life. But only if you spare mine.
I Don't deal with dead men.
Kill me, I kill the girl. How much is your revenge worth, Major? I will, of course, need your word as an officer that you will let me live. Don's decision is lighting fast.
Help her.
I've got a com signal. Suddenly the radio SQUAWKS into life.
...Is Mission Control. Do you read? Jupiter Two this is
Emergency power's on line. I think I can get these blast shields open. VIEWSCREEN CLOSE. The blast shields part to reveal a gian in their path. They are heading directly for the sun.
Uh-oh.
Noah stands over the Com. The room is a madhouse.
Give me a telemetry projection. Noah looks up at the main monitor. The graphic of the Jup heading towards the graphic of the sun.
John and Don stand over the Com.
You're way off course. We show you in the sun's gravitational pull.
How long do we have?
We count seven minutes before your outer hull begins to melt. DON straps himself into the pilot's chair.
I'm going to try for the Mercury Mines. SMITH stands at the freezing tube, Penny and Maureen assi
I will need Dr. Robinson's portable gurney. I believe it is stored in-
I'm on it. Penny races off. Smith begins working the controls to Jud tube.
We trusted you. (sinking in) You tried to kill us all.

Existence offers us nothing if not the opportunity for an endless series of betrayals. (off her stunned expression) There's a world behind the world, Professor Robinson. Lie once, cheat twice and everything becomes clear. Do not mistake my deception for a character flaw. It is philosophical choice, a profound understanding of the universe. It is a way of life.
You're a monster.
Perhaps. But I am also the only one who can save your daughter's life. Penny reappears, a case in hand. She presses a button and unfolds into a hovering, gyroscopicaly-leveled gurney.
Where's Will?
He's futzing with that Robot.
Alright, Penny dear, I need you to short the power on my command.
Does he have to call me dear?
Professor, if you will assist me in lowering the body. Smith hands Penny a wrench.
Penny, dear. Now. Maureen nods. Penny SLAMS the wrench into the power circu freezing field FLARES and deactivates, the tube swinging LIFESIGN MONITOR-CLOSE. Flatline.
She's dying. Smith and Maureen lower her onto the gurney.
Sickbay. Move. Penny, Maureen and Smith rush the gurney out the blast do Sickbay just as the ship tilts madly.
WINDSCREEN-CLOSE. The sun is growing ever larger.
Unable to re-route to Mercury. The sun's pull is too strong. (a beat) Noah, I need options.
Major West we are unable to provide contingencies. (a beat) I'm sorry, Don. ON SCREEN-THE JUPITER TWO is heading towards the sun.
Penny, Smith and Maureen have transferred Judy onto a hi- scanning-bed. A hovering holographic schematic of Judy's appears over her, descends onto her body.
No cardio-pulmonary or respiratory functions.
Body temp at 68 Fahrenheit.
Get her flight suit off. Penny unzips the silver material as Smith works the conso highlighting her holographic heart.
Clear. The holographic image of her heart beats once, then is st

Power's down.
We're losing her. CHAPTER 10: Initiate Hyperdrive
DON and John man the Com. The sun is a raging fireball de
I've re-routed all secondary systems to the main drive.
She won't budge. Shortest baby sitting mission I've ever done.
My family's not going die in space.
I'm open to suggestions.
Outer hull breach in 30 seconds.
Smith begins pumping Judy's chest by hand.
Come on, child. Fight. Put a little heart in it. Smith steps back, begins precise, staccato blows to Judy'
The life.. . (hit ) I save ... (hit) may be (hit) my own. Smith stops, presses his ear to her chest - Takes her pul
Judy? Baby? A beat. Then Judy opens her eyes, manages a weak smile.
You should try to look less worried. It has a tendency to spook the patients.
(to Smith) Thank you. Smith holds her gaze, his eyes almost snake-like.

You are a good woman, Maureen. Any man could see that. I hope I have proven the well-being of your family is of great importance to me. Perhaps, if you convinced your husband to trust me... Maureen stares at him. A beat. She pulls a laser from the it at his forehead.
Stabilize her, Smith. Because you only breathe as long as she does.
The ship is shaking in the mighty pull of the sun. Don is to keep the ship stable.
Heat seal breach in 20 seconds.
There's got to be some way to get through this. DON stares at him.
That's it.
What's it?
We can't get away from the sun. So we have to go through it. The hyperdrive -
Engage the hyperdrive without a gate, we could be thrown anywhere in the galaxy
Anywhere but here.
We're getting resident radiation distortions from the space craft. She must be breaking up.
Let me see those numbers, Annie. The Techie hands him a sheet. Noah looks for a beat.
Son of a bitch. He's powering up the hyperdrive.
The saucer is elongating slightly, changing its shape as to enter hyperspace.
Will scrambles onto the bridge, heads towards John who is main control panel.
Hyperengines coming on line.
Warning. Heat shield breach. The sun covers the entire windscreen, a furious landscape
Hyperdrive at 100 percent. Major, you have the Com.

Zero to 20 million miles a second in under a minute. Let's see what this baby can do. John takes Will's hand as West engages the hyperdrive. West, John and Will, are hurled backwards from the sudden acceleration, sticking to the walls and ceiling respectiv
Maureen and Penny watch as Smith swaddles Judy in thermal Suddenly, Maureen, Penny, and Smith fly against the walls held in place by the gurney straps.
The graphic of the space craft is beginning to flicker as with the graphic of the sun.

Godspeed.

The Jupiter Two flies into the mighty ball of the sun. An reaches the tallest of the gaseous mountains, the ship be translucent, falling through the orb, elongating and then a sudden star of hyperspace.

Quiet. Empty. Suddenly space distorts and, in a sudden fl appears, hurling into the darkness. The Jupiter Two. The Jupiter Two comes to rest at the edge of an alien, tw solar system, near a giant crimson planet. CHAPTER 11: Lost in Space
Maureen kneels before Penny and Will, making sure they're stands silently in the b.g. Judy's gurney is empty. John face wrought with fatherly concern.
Is everyone okay?
All in one piece. Although Major West has the most puzzling definition of a smooth ride.
Judy? Where's Judy? Just then Judy emerges through a door, zipping up her fli
Boy either I cut down on the coffee or sew in a flap. It's hell getting in and out of this thing.
Are you-
Vitals are normal. Pulse and respiration seem to be-
Baby, are you okay?
I'm fine Daddy really. John holds her close, spared a father's worst fear.
Will every disaster be an excuse for familial sentiment? Please tell me now so I may gather up a liberal supply of space sickness bags. Don turns towards Smith. Maureen steps between them.
What happened, John? Where are we?
Don in at the navigational holograph, patching sparking w rest of the crew emerge onto the bridge.
You had me worried, Doc. Nice to see you thawed.
Smart maneuver with the hyper-drive.
A fighter who thinks, what do you know? You're just in time for the show. Don makes a connection. The pedestal powers up, a hologra Jupiter Two appearing over its surface.
Computer, map our current location. HOLOGRAPHIC PEDESTAL-CLOSE. The area around the Jupiter T filled with a holographic representation of the alien sol
See anything familiar? Don just shakes his head.
Searching for recognizable constellations. (a beat) Unable to locate.
This computer has star maps of the entire known galaxy.
We're lost, aren't we? Judy wraps her arm around her sister.
What the hell is that? VIEWSCREEN- CLOSE. The nearest planet is starting to glow distortion field begins to emanate from the alien world. space seem to sear away, leaving a glowing portal.
Any effect on the ship?
No. VIEWSCREEN -CLOSE. All the planets and constellations bey portal appear to be in different places.
(off the navigational hologram) All the planets have moved.

As the ship moves back in front of the portal, the hole i visible again, the giant probe ship revealed once more wi

A doorway to where?
If we want to reach that ship, we're going to have to find out.
The Jupiter Two flies through the pulsing hole in space.
The giant, silver ship looms in the windscreen.
No apparent effects on the ship.
I'm hailing on all frequencies. No response.
There are some markings on the starboard side. Can you throw some light on her?
Don't know if the exterior spots are working.- There we go. THE WINDSCREEN-CLOSE. Powerful spotlights hit the ship. WEST AND JOHN-CLOSE. And really surprised.
If this in all a dream, why can't there be more girls? THE SPACESHIP-CLOSE. Essentially a needle covered with me On its hull, under the legend PROTEUS, an American flag.
I've never seen a design like this. what are those scales on her hull?
How could Earth launch a ship this massive and neither of us know about it? ... It just doesn't make sense.
These scanners are damaged, I'm getting inconsistent life signs but they may be sensor ghosts.
Maybe her computer's still up. I'm trying standard remote access codes. ON SCREEN-A docking ring on the giant ship comes to life, coming to life, the docking aperture rotating open.
What do you know?
The Jupiter Two heads towards the giant ship.
Can you give me some light on the secondary docking ring? A smaller docking ring is illuminated on the viewscreen.
What do you make of that? Attached to the starboard docking ring is another, smalle snaking anthropomorphic lines are not of human design.

The Jupiter moves into the docking ring of the giant ship

Crush. REVERSE ANGLE. The Robot in rolling in through the doorwa waving wildly before him.

Crush. Kill. Destroy.
Crush! Kill! Destroy! Will points to several jury-rigged modifications.
I hacked into his CPU, bypassed his main operating system and accessed his sub-routines. He's basically running on remote control. All stare at him. Penny finally speaks.
Show off.
Penny stands guard, a rifle in her hand, talking into her
And so the Space Captive finds herself helping the Robinsons by guarding the traitor. And she finds- Penny's VOICE trails off. Stares out the porthole. Endles
She finds that out here, in the dark and cold, she's scared, and she's kind of glad they're all together. Just then Don approaches, a silver bundle under his arm.
Identify yourself, soldier.
West, Major, United Space Force, requesting permission to see the prisoner. Penny steps aside.
Proceed Major West. Don smiles, winks at her, going through the door.
Ouch. Could he be cuter? I don't think so.
Actually a med-lab. Smith turns to face Don an he ENTERS.
These quarters are totally unacceptable. I demand- Don tosses his bundle on the seat. A silver flight suit.
We're going to check out the probe ship. Maybe we can figure out how they got here. And how to get home.
Ta-ta. Have a wonderful trip.
You're coming with us.
Out of the question. I'm a doctor not a space explorer. You and- But Don is in his face in a heartbeat.
What you are is a murderous saboteur and I am not leaving you on this ship so you can do more harm than you've already caused.
I absolutely refuse-
(closer) Give me an excuse to kill you. Please. Smith stares at him a beat. Then he smiles, looks to the
Silver always was my color.
Will stands in front of the Robot, polishing a blast mark
When boarding a mysterious spacecraft, it always pays to look your best. John enters, removes a gun from the weapons locker.
Deactivate safety.
Voiceprint confirmed. Rifle is active. GUN-CLOSE. A small light goes from red to green.
You did a good job up there son. You saved us all.
Thanks. An awkward silence hangs between them.
I know I haven't around much these days.That we haven't had time to-
Professor, we're ready. John looks at his boy Will in silent.
Will, you're the most important thing in the world to me. I hope one day you'll be able to see that. With that, John walks out. Will stares after him. Faces t

The air is stale. Old.
That's the smell of ghosts. Don walks to a computer panel set into the wall. Begins t

Not working?
No, it's just, I don't know, too fast. Most of the systems are down. The Robot rolls deeper into the alien ship. The others fo lights flicker into life, illuminating the long corridor

If I didn't know better I'd say this is blood.
I know an omen when I see one. I suggest a hasty retreat.
Just imagine we're retreating in the opposite direction. Now, move it. Don shoves Smith forward with the butt of his laser rifle heading deeper into the quiet ship.
Will watches through the Robot's POV, toggling to move th forward. A readout marked AUDIO flashes. Will turns up a control. (OVER) the sound of a slow, steady DRIP.
Dad, do you....
... Hear something? The Robot turns, begins heading further down the corridor DRIPPING can be heard by all.
Like the drip, drip, drip of blood..
You really need to shut up.
(pointing) Here. THE CEILING shows a jagged hole, covered with some kind o membrane, leading to the dark of a service tunnel above. DRIPS steadily onto the floor below.
That material appears biological.
Nothing good will come of this.
What makes you such an expert?
Trust me, Major. Evil knows evil.
Let's find the bridge. Maybe we can get some answers. They head off. HOLD on the dripping membrane.
Maureen is at the main sensor console working an instrume Penny is hanging upside down in a harness overhead, using welder on a giant mass of exposed ceiling circuitry.
Try it now, Mom. Maureen throws a switch. The panel lights up, then goes d
Damn.
The boarding party stand at the end of the corridor. Don wall panel. The giant doors hiss open to REVEAL...
Immense. Empty. And battle torn. Sections of the controls blown away. Blast scoring mars the walls.
What the hell happened in here?

Some kind of fire fight. Look at this technology. I've seen some of this before. On the drawing boards. Smith has moved off slightly, wandered over to a STORAGE Within, a row of docked Robots, larger and sleeker then o John and Don are powering up the Com, console lights comi
Can you bring up the Captain's log?
The data has degraded. I'm going try and gather any fragments I can. There isn't much, but ... here we go. MAIN SCREEN-CLOSE. Fills with snow. Then a figure can be Jab. But his hair is grey.
Jeb.
The hyperspace tracker seems to be functioning... (static) No sign of the Jupiter Two...
(static) Have exceeded our mission timetable by two... (static) I'm not willing to give up. Don would keep looking for me.
That's it. The rest of the data is totally corrupted. IN THE ALCOVE, Smith frees a power pack from one of the r it into the sleeve cuff of his field suit.
This doesn't make sense. How could they launch a rescue mission for us when we've only been lost a day? Judy stands by the life sciences panel.
I've got something here. A turning holograph appears over the console panel. A deg of a trembling, viscous pouch. Tiny shapes move within.
They brought it up from the planet's surface. It's seems to be some sort of egg sack. Don notices Smith's standing in the storage alcove.
Smith, step away from there.
Happy to oblige, Major. Although I don't think it's me you should be worrying about. But rather this. In the corner of the ceiling, another membrane covered ho
Will is at his station, watching Don and John via the Rob
I'm detecting motion. Behind you...
A towering SHADOW shoots past the open doorway.
After it. Move. (to the Robot) Bring Smith.

Don races down the corridor. The walls are matted with fl plants. Vines twist into a carpet covering the metallic f THE SCURRYING SHAPE, about the size of a small dog, shoot behind a bulkhead, disappearing into the lush greenery. Don pushes forward through the ever deepening brush until a door. A plaque reads HYDROPONICS LAB. He races inside.
A jungle. John and Judy arrive behind Don.
This explains where all the plants came from.
Growth like this would take decades. The Robot arrives through the lab door, carrying Smith in
Unhand me, you mechanical moron. Don's eyes fix behind Smith's head.
